value.title: Mask diplomacy: How coronavirus upended generations of China-Japan antagonism
value.excerpt: While the coronavirus crisis has led many states and non-state actors to behave in their own self-interest, others have endeavored to distribute supplies to those who need them most. Perhaps nowhere has that act of goodwill been as pronounced — and surprising — as the generous gifting between Japan and China, write Cheng Li and Ryan McElveen.

value.title: The Tokyo 2020 Olympic Flame Will Be Lit Without Any Spectators in Attendance
value.excerpt: The 2020 Tokyo Olympic Flame will be lit without any spectators in attendance due to growing fears over the coronavirus. The Hellenic Olympic Committee made the announcement on Monday, noting that only a hundred pre-approved members from the International Olympic Committee and the Tokyo 2020 Organizing Committee will be present to witness the Lighting Ceremony of the Olympic Flame.
